Articles.Content:
I've been thinking about doing a modded-planet career mode. I think that this might be what I'll use.

Also, unless you can modify the color of the light from the sun, I'd keep the sun as it is now, or make it a white dwarf. It would be kind of weird to have yellow light coming from a blue star.

Thanks dude, the stars won't be implemented until after kopernicus 0.0.7, so it's still on the stock system for now. The color of light emitted will be modifiable, so blue stars can have blue light and red stars can have red light, even IVA views get the color changes! see here for a little peek (very rough early version); http://i.imgur.com/xn5yTZH.png

Update 1.5 is now live!

Although no new stars yet, this update patches ALOT of annoying things i always forgot to fix.

Changelog;

  • Increased surface colormap resolution for most bodies
  • Fixed pressure & temperature curves to replicate stock atmospheres
  • Tweaked many textures and normals
  • Moved CRP resources to separate install to avoid problems
  • Included CRP in download to prevent 'M700' bug
  • Tweaked Planetshine configs to reflect atmospheres properly
  • Fixed Ernus being too close to the Sun to reach
  • Greatly reduced 'lines' on Derso's terrain
  • Fixed Ete having parts of surface underground
  • Fixed Etal's height causing ships to be flung off the surface

  • Arin Tweaks
    • -Fixed Terrain brightness at midday
    • -Increased Atmosphere height to 52km
    • -increased ASL pressure to 0.35

    [*]Serran Tweaks

    • -Fixed Terrain brightness at midday
    • -Increased Atmosphere height to 61km
    • -Increased ASL pressure to 0.45
    • -Flattened terrain to give rolling hills instead of high peaks everywhere

    [*]Lave tweaks

    • -Increased Atmosphere height to 38km
    • -Increased ASL pressure to 0.15
    • -Reduced terrain 'lines' greatly, terrain is a lot flatter now

    [*]Leouch Tweaks

    • -Lowered Leouch's pressure to 21atm
    • -Increased atmosphere height to 85km

    [*]Titanus Tweaks

    • -Fixed Terrain brightness at midday
    • -Fixed horizon color being too bright

The new Sun: Other, in the comments, a black hole! Yes. Black hole.

If you really, really cant do that, a Neutron Star.

I personally think Kerbin should still be a planet and not a Moon... Can you tell me what to change in the config file to make that work?

Install the HyperEdit mod and you can change the orbits of Kerbin or ANY object

Noticing an odd camera/terrain glitch with 1.5 (reverting to 1.4.12 fixes this immediately, even by just replacing the files), when launching from Kerbin, the camera impacts something about 1350-1400m above the launchpad that causes it to jerk upwards and then flip back to viewing the rocket. This happens while zooming out while not in flight as well. Kerbal Engineer Redux also notes that terrain height resets the second this happens, so it goes from 1400-ish meters to 0. Running a whole host of mods, so I could attribute this to one of those, but I'll list them anyway. 

    
[LIST]   
[*]USI Tools - 0.4.1    
[*]Ambient Light Adjustment - 1.4.3.1    
[*]Community Resource Pack - 0.4.2    
[*]Firespitter - 7.1.2    
[*]Kerbal Construction Time - 1.1.7    
[*]Kerbal Engineer Redux - 1.0.16.6    
[*]KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.5    
[*]Modular Rocket Systems - 1.6.5    
[*]PlanetShine - 0.2.3.1    
[*]RealChute - 1.3.2.3    
[*]SCANsat - 1.1.2    
[*]SpaceY Lifters - 0.13.1    
[*]StageRecovery - 1.5.6    
[*]USI Exploration Pack - 0.4.1    
[*]Karbonite - 0.6.2    
[*]Karbonite Plus - 0.4    
[*]MKS - 0.30.1    
[*]USI-LS - 0.1.2    
[*]USI Survivability Pack - 0.3    
[/LIST]

I am running in DX11 (Windows 7, 32-bit KSP), but I can't even get to my save files with DX9, it crashes to desktop before it can even start loading. Edit: Made a stock install with just New Horizons v1.5 installed, same issue.

Edited May 29, 2015 by IggyHitokage

Noticing an odd camera/terrain glitch with 1.5 (reverting to 1.4.12 fixes this immediately, even by just replacing the files), when launching from Kerbin, the camera impacts something about 1350-1400m above the launchpad that causes it to jerk upwards and then flip back to viewing the rocket. This happens while zooming out while not in flight as well. Kerbal Engineer Redux also notes that terrain height resets the second this happens, so it goes from 1400-ish meters to 0. Running a whole host of mods, so I could attribute this to one of those, but I'll list them anyway. 
    
[LIST]
[*]USI Tools - 0.4.1 
[*]Ambient Light Adjustment - 1.4.3.1 
[*]Community Resource Pack - 0.4.2 
[*]Firespitter - 7.1.2 
[*]Kerbal Construction Time - 1.1.7 
[*]Kerbal Engineer Redux - 1.0.16.6 
[*]KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.5 
[*]Modular Rocket Systems - 1.6.5 
[*]PlanetShine - 0.2.3.1 
[*]RealChute - 1.3.2.3 
[*]SCANsat - 1.1.2 
[*]SpaceY Lifters - 0.13.1 
[*]StageRecovery - 1.5.6 
[*]USI Exploration Pack - 0.4.1 
[*]Karbonite - 0.6.2 
[*]Karbonite Plus - 0.4 
[*]MKS - 0.30.1 
[*]USI-LS - 0.1.2 
[*]USI Survivability Pack - 0.3 
[/LIST]

I am running in DX11 (Windows 7, 32-bit KSP), but I can't even get to my save files with DX9, it crashes to desktop before it can even start loading. Edit: Made a stock install with just New Horizons v1.5 installed, same issue.

missed this post somehow, but thanks for letting me know. I know what you mean, it was a bug i saw in 1.4 versions but i hadn't seen for quite a while...I'll try to figure out whats going on ASAP. As far as i can tell it's just a camera bug and doesn't cause issues for planet's or crafts in flight...just really annoying now that i noticed it

I like the work you are doing with this mod. The new environments are really enjoyable. However, I have encountered a bug with the latest release. If the texture quality is set to full res and the game is relaunched afterwards the game will automatically crash without posting an error log. This means the entire install is basically broken afterwards as the game can't make it past the loading bar. I would post an error log but as I mentioned previously, the game simply doesn't create one. From my testing, this happens with or without any mods present in the game (including Active texture management). If you need any further info on this issue feel free to contact me.

I like the work you are doing with this mod. The new environments are really enjoyable. However, I have encountered a bug with the latest release. If the texture quality is set to full res and the game is relaunched afterwards the game will automatically crash without posting an error log. This means the entire install is basically broken afterwards as the game can't make it past the loading bar. I would post an error log but as I mentioned previously, the game simply doesn't create one. From my testing, this happens with or without any mods present in the game (including Active texture management). If you need any further info on this issue feel free to contact me.

can't replicate this unfortunately, I turned every setting to max and still load fine. What OS are you using and does it run alright at lower res?

missed this post somehow, but thanks for letting me know. I know what you mean, it was a bug i saw in 1.4 versions but i hadn't seen for quite a while...I'll try to figure out whats going on ASAP. As far as i can tell it's just a camera bug and doesn't cause issues for planet's or crafts in flight...just really annoying now that i noticed it
Sorry! Just wanted to give a little (hopefully) helpful feedback. Really been enjoying this mod in conjunction with USI-LS, certainly have to plan literal years in advance so I don't starve my Kerbals.

Haha no need to apologize I had almost forgotten about that bug! I play with USI-LS too, wish they had something like deep freeze that TAC had ...Aaah well, it's that challenge of preparation I guess!

so i got a little bored tonight...think it's something I'll have to work on quite a bit, but it's a start though:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
@KillAshley I was wondering, where are these OPM patches that you described???

@KillAshley I was wondering, where are these OPM patches that you described???

heres the OPM config for you:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/zhibz1ju5ktnz52/OPMPatch.zip?dl=0

install new horizons, then install OPM without overwriting any files (very important). then drop that .cfg into your files.

I'm not putting them in the OP yet as I'm waiting until Kopernicus 0.0.7 comes out so we can actually have proper compatibility. I cannot guarantee that there won't be errors as it changes OPM's kopernicus version to mine, but it works.

can't replicate this unfortunately, I turned every setting to max and still load fine. What OS are you using and does it run alright at lower res?

Im running the latest Windows 8.1 update as my current OS. The game does run fine at lower res, although for some reason the Mun and many other planetoids don't seem to have any SOI's. I can still land on them but they don't have any gravitational pull on any craft that passes to close to them at all, even when I skimmed the Mun with a perihelion of only 10k I could't get any kind of pull from the Mun at all so I'm not really sure what is up with that......I dont think my install is damaged and I have downloaded the latest release from Kurse so I really don't know what's going on :/

Hello

Noticing an odd camera/terrain glitch with 1.5 ...... the camera impacts something about 1350-1400m above the launchpad ................

I had this with the stock VTOL. If you are slow enough the ship explodes. Found a second point behind the end of the runway on the ground (found it as I landed and was a little bit short). Easy to replicate. Just roll down the runway and leave it at the end.

Here a log from the test rolling just around the runway.

Now enough of explosions.

Thanks for sharing this great mod. The Optics are very impressive and the layout of the system is harmonius. The idea to make a planet with a planetwide canyon, wow - canÃ‚Â´t wait to get there. A nice experience at all.
thanks for letting me know dude, we're trying to figure out whats happening atm...even RSS is having this problem with it's latest builds

thanks for letting me know dude, we're trying to figure out whats happening atm...even RSS is having this problem with it's latest builds

So even more information on the camera issue, I hope it will help.

I've observed twice, after a short vertical ascent (4000m~), my ship crashes if I am going above "safe landing speed" 0-7m/s, at 1421 meters. If my parachutes are fully open, that is not the case.

This issue seems to only replicate itself over the launch pad, I haven't checked over the landing strip.

Parachutes deploy as if that camera wobble altitude is 0.

If I fall below 1421~ Meters outside the ksp buildings, my parachutes deploy properly and at the correct 500 altitude. Everything is normal.

Not sure if you have heard all this before, but I hope it helps. This is a really, really cool mod.

I have the problem when landing at ksc landing strip with a plane. At a short distance above the ground (50-150m using diazo landing height mod) the plane explodes when I come from the seaside. Havent tried from the other direction yet.

I havent had a problem launching rockets and havent managed to land at ksc launch pad yet.

At my setup with the landing height mod, i can see that when i get to around 1400m the meter that shows height resets and starts from 0 again.

Hope this can help with the bugsearch

Espen

@Sagewynn & @Espen869

thanks for the info guys, I'll keep trying to figure out a way around it. Obviously i want this fixed as badly as you do, as it's a pretty annoying issue. Keep up the info, never know what will help

Thanks for being patient with me while this problem exists!

missed this post somehow, but thanks for letting me know. I know what you mean, it was a bug i saw in 1.4 versions but i hadn't seen for quite a while...I'll try to figure out whats going on ASAP. As far as i can tell it's just a camera bug and doesn't cause issues for planet's or crafts in flight...just really annoying now that i noticed it

Sometimes my planes/rockets explode around this height saying collided with surface. So its more than just annoying

Amazing mod though either way.

Sometimes my planes/rockets explode around this height saying collided with surface. So its more than just annoying

Amazing mod though either way.

I have this same issue, except for me it happens every single time. If I leave a certain area around the KSC and try to fly back to it, I explode at any height from any direction of approach every time. Sasdly it's made the mod unplayable

if you watch what happens when you launch a rocket, when this happens the exhaust spreads out (the same way it does against the launchpad when you first launch) along a plane that is at an angle to the ground (it looks tilted about 30 degrees or so from the horizontal, from my eyeballing. I have that custom-timewarp mod installed, so I was able to set physic warp to .1x and see it happen.

I recommend that you make Aptur a moon of Kerbin. Right now with two bodies so close together things get pretty buggy and weird. It would also make it a much easier early science target if it were orbiting kerbin, and it would make the whole Sonnah system feel less cluttered.

I recommend that you make Aptur a moon of Kerbin. Right now with two bodies so close together things get pretty buggy and weird. It would also make it a much easier early science target if it were orbiting kerbin, and it would make the whole Sonnah system feel less cluttered.

I know we're in a video game and everything, but its semi realistic, but that's extremely rare if not impossible. There was a video on it on why our moon doesn't have a moon, and it came down to the earths gravity is too strong and it would pull the smaller body out of its orbit.

^^ This! To be fare I added Aptur to the system as a small bump to science in the early game. Typically it takes me less delta v to get to Aptur then it does to get to Mun in the stock system so moving it into Kerbin's SOI is not only unrealistic, but pretty weak idea (no offense)

Sry I haven't been around much everyone...kinda got sucked into Ark Survival Evolved, and haven't been able to pry myself off it. When I have time I'll be updating to the new version of Kopernicus and adding in some new features...along with (hopefully) fixing a lot of bugs!

Thanks for the patience with the errors in the current version.
